ref: 1559 iṇḍvà n. du. ʻ two coverings made of muñja grass to protect the hands from the fire ʼ ŚBr. 2. iṇḍúva -- . 3. *induva -- . [Cf. uṇḍuka -- and vīṭa -- with list of words there given: Pa. aṇḍuva -- , ˚uka -- n. ʻ a roll (of cloth, hairs, or the like), aṇḍūpaka -- n. ʻ circular roll of cloth used as a stand for a vessel ʼ]
S. iṇḍo m. ʻ back of the hand ʼ;
Or. iṇḍā ʻ knob of an oven ʼ; -- both very doubtful semant.
